page.title: 14LANGTON HOUSING
page.content: There are many different types of houses;houses that have been owned for several generations by one family and houses that are new and modern with wonderful appliances. Some buildings were designed as barns, coach houses etc. but have now been converted into homes. Most of the modern houses are either detached or semi-detached and many of these are owned by commuters. There are terraced houses, mainly occupied by elderly people, because they are small and therefore are relatively easy and cheap to run; also it is good for old people to have other people living near at hand. There are not many flats the few there that exist are mainly occupied by elderly people and young families. There are only a few bungalows in the village. There are also quite a lot of large expensive houses in the village.
